doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/F4Q Recap Game onF4Q Recap Game on_2025-08-28

passages.text: USA | Consumer Finance

GMV and revenue both beat guidance and the high-end of the guidance range,leading to EPS of $0.20 vs. Street's $0.11. AFRM continued to lean into their 0%APR product with lower risk and lower yields, which led to network revenue up 37%. FY26 guidance shows upside to consensus estimates, with stable RLTC margins, despite the mix shift. AFRM noted that they will continue to lean into the 0% APR product and look for further growth opportunities internationally.

**F4Q25 First Take: GMV and revenue beat Street estimates, and was above the high-end of the** **guide range. Diluted EPS of $0.20 was head of both JEFe/Street of $0.18/$0.11, respectively.** **AFRM continues to lean into their 0% APR products, leading to 37% growth in network volumes.** GMV of $10.4B was above Street's $9.6B and the guide of $9.4-9.7B, up 43% Y/Y. Total revs of $876M (+33% Y/Y) was ahead of the Street's $837M, and guide of $815-845M, largely driven by 37% increase in network revenue. RTLC of $425M above cons and the high-end of the guide range of $385M-$400M, while transaction costs were roughly consistent with estimates. Sales and marketing of $80M beat the Street's $89M fcst driving the overall OPEX beat. Adjusted operating income of $237M beat the consensus of $204M.
See our First Look for more details.

**0% APR financing driving growth and user acquisition** - Zero-percent APR installment loans were a standout driver in Q4. GMV from 0% APR monthly installments **jumped ~93%** year-on-year, as merchant adoption of these promotional plans more than doubled to over 25,000 participating merchants (roughly 7% of active merchants). These interest-free offers brought in many new customers - roughly 50% of all new Affirm users in the quarter started with a 0% loan. Nearly 95% of 0% APR GMV at integrated merchants is subsidized by the merchant, allowing Affirm to still earn revenue on these loans. In short, the 0% product is expanding Affirm's network efficiently (more shoppers and merchants) while remaining profitable.

**International Expansion** - Affirm is actively expanding overseas, with an initial focus on the UK and broader Europe. The UK offering will include both pay-in-4 style plans and longer-term installments,as local merchants have expressed demand for longer duration financing. Beyond the UK, Affirm plans to enter Western Europe next (targeting markets like France, Germany, and the Netherlands).Management indicated they will leverage Affirm's multinational merchant partners to enter new regions efficiently, and release the existing platform and data capabilities across markets.

**Thoughts on stock** AFRM had another strong quarter beats across a number of KPIs. Credit continues to show stability as the mix shifts to better credit customers using the 0% APR product.Initial FY26 guidance was a strong starting point which we believe embeds further upside, given AFRM's history of being conservative with guidance. We recommend AFRM given strong growth,scale and constructive execution.
Equity ResearchAugust 28,2025

**John Hecht*|Equity Analyst**
**Alexander Villalobos*|Equity Associate**
**Yuna Sohn*|Equity Associate**
**Jonathan Weitz*|Equity Associate**

We believe that despite strong growth prospects, partnerships and declining unit economics are key concerns. We are concerned about the lack of profitability in what we consider an ideal environment for BNPL with low rates, high GOS margins and record- low levels of NCOs/DQs We expect the MDR to come under pressure as legacy players attempt to defend share and as new entrants hike up competition
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Affirm's merchant discount rate (MDR) and gain on sale margins compress as a result of ongoing competition As the broader eCommerce and BNPL market grows, Affirm sees strong growth and adoption as well, diversifying its revenue stream Normalization of credit performance over time MDR remains stable, and losses normalize Price target: \(\) 110\(\) 58.8x our FY27 GAAP earnings estimate

Affirm's merchant discount rate remains consistent as competitive pressures ease The transition to a neobank occurs faster than expected, with new product offerings adopted quickly by customers New product lines help drive organic earnings growth Affirm captures more of the BNPL market than competitors, leading to greater- than- expected growth Credit performance and GOS margins remain consistent Upside price target: \(\) 140\(or 74.9x our FY27 GAAP earnings estimate

Gain on sale, merchant discount rate are compressed faster than expected due to intensifying competition Economic reopening negatively affects Peloton sales, hurting Affirm due to product concentration Rising rates increase COF ahead of expectations Expenses outpace our forecast NCOs surpass historical averages, which combined with ALLL builds results in a higher provision Downside price target: \(\) 75\(or 40.1x FY27 GAAP earnings estimate

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Selling practices and product labeling: Regulators are consistently focused on fair lending, responsible marketing, and financial inclusion. It is essential that lending is consistent with requirements and constructive for consumers. 2) Data security: The company must continually manage risks related to collection, retention, and use of sensitive, confidential, and/or proprietary customer or user data.

Company Target(s): 1) Hire and promote more leaders from under-represented groups, especially Black leaders, 2) Measure and increase merchant diversity, 3) Partner with organizations focused on housing security, civic engagement, etc.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What processes are in place to ensure fair lending as well as customer data security? What material risks are there in terms of engaging with the CFPB? 2) What are the company's short- term and medium- term goals at the board and firm level for DE&I?
ESG Sector Deep Dive: Consumer Finance (March 2023)
Credit performance Ongoing growth of eComm Take rate changes at existing partners Competition and impacts on MDR Macrofactors influencing COF and GOS margins Profitability

Credit quality - DQs excluding Peloton and Pay-in-X is improved - 15 bps Q/Q and decreased - 18 bps Y/Y, showing robust credit performance and undercutting. The Q/Q improvement was driven by the mix shift to 0% APR products and shorter average loan term for these products. Consumers that only use the 0% APR products have an average score 40 points higher than the average AFRM user. Recent NCO cohorts for monthly installment loans are tracking towards approx. 3.5% as a percent of cohort GMV, which is consistent with prior historical cohorts. All recent NCO vintages of Pay-in-4 loans are continuing to track to loss rates of less than 1% of GMV. Notably, about 95% of Q4 transactions came from repeat users, giving Affirm rich data to lend responsibly.

FY26 guidance is in- line or better than Street estimates and shows persistent growth patterns with stable margins and ongoing scale. GMV guidance of \(+\) 46M is above JEFe/Street. Revenue is roughly in- line with consensus estimates. RLTC as \(\%\) of GMV was guided to \(\sim 4\%\) , above estimates and constructive for ongoing growth. Adj. operating margins are expected to expand to \(\sim 26.1\%\) vs. JEFe of 26.1%. F1Q26 guidance was better than JEF/Street on GMV and RLTC. Revenue estimates were at the low- end of the guidance range. RLTC as \(\%\) of GMV guidance was 3.9%- 4.2% and shows persistence, despite the shift to 0% APR products. Overall, the guidance was strong and remains constructive to AFRM's growth
Exhibit 1 - F1Q26 Guidance v. JEFe/Street

Model updates. We updated our model for results, guide, industry trends, and mgmt comments. Our FY26/FY27 GMV estimates go up to \(\) 47.0B/$58.6B, respectively, and our RTLC forecasts are \(\) 1.873B\(in FY26 and\) \ \(2.285B\) in FY27. Our FY26/FY27 GAAP EPS forecasts increase to \(\) 1.24/\(\) 1.87\(respectively, as shown in Exhibit 2. We model for adjusted EPS of\) \ \(2.30\) and \(\) 3.11\(, respectively, as well. We model\) 3.99\% \(RLTC margin in FY26 and\) 3.90\% \(in FY27.
Affirm (AFRM) John Hecht - 415.229.1569 Alexander Villalobos- Morsink - 415.229.1479 Yuna Sohn - 415.416.9219 Jonathan Weitz - 415.229.8717

AffirmAffirm Holdings, Inc. operates a platform for digital and mobile- first commerce. AFrm's point- of- sale solution allows consumers to pay for purchases in fixed amounts without deferred interest, hidden fees, or penalties. The company empowers consumers to pay over time rather than paying for a purchase entirely upfront. This increases consumers' purchasing power and gives them more control and flexibility. It offers integrated checkout, virtual cards, split pay, Affirm app and marketplace, and savings accounts. The company was incorporated as a holding company on June 18, 2019. Affirm's business was founded by Max Levchin in 2012 and is headquartered in San Francisco, CA.

Our target price of \(110 equals to a\) 58.8x FY27 GAAP earnings estimate, in line with the peer group. Risks to our price target include credit, revenue concentration, competition, and the macroeconomic environment.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.

NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/ growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Affirm Holdings, Inc. (AFRM: \(\) 79.99\(, BUY)

**Notes:** Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company.
